memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “To everything there is a season, and a time to every purpose under heaven.”(Ecclesiastes 3:1)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Reaching in time is a noble practice of disciplined and godly people. They are always prepared to do what is right. Delay leads to decay; delay leads to decline. When we begin or finish things on time, we honor God’s order.

Our Lord is a God of perfect timing. Nature itself reveals His accuracy  the sun, moon, tides, and seasons move without a single second’s delay. Even the Israelites journey was fulfilled exactly on the day God had appointed 400 years before.

So must we learn to walk in His divine timing  not too early, not too late. Reach out to pray in time, worship in time, and serve in time. Punctuality in spiritual life is not just discipline  it is obedience. Move in God’s timing, and blessings will never delay in reaching you.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “God is never late, and rarely early. He is always right on time.” (Corrie Ten Boom)

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text:
Lord, teach me to value Your timing in all I do.
Help me to pray, serve, and move at the right time not in haste, nor in delay. Let my steps be in sync with Your divine order. Make me sensitive to Your perfect seasons.
In Jesus’ name, Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May you walk in God’s perfect time and never miss His appointed moment. What you do on time, God will bless in His time.

recommended_book.label: Recommended Book
recommended_book.title: In Step with God
recommended_book.author: Charles F. Stanley
recommended_book.quote: Learn how to recognize and follow God’s perfect timing
